attributes.action: require publicly-funded bodies, in light of the Government's newly published Open Source policy, to fully explore free and open source software before choosing proprietary systems
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The UK Government recently published an updated Open Source policy which among other things endeavours to have open source software solutions considered properly.

It is vital that this policy is followed to level the playing field and allow the public to benefit from the myriad advantages of open source.

In light of the recession it is imperative that the billions of pounds of public money spent on IT is used wisely, and in this economic environment open source is particularly well-placed to meet the needs of public bodies in terms of lowering both immediate costs and ongoing licensing fees.

Any decision to license a proprietary system should be fully documented and open to scrutiny through Freedom of Information legislation.
